radiology.CT: concern for cholecystitis, distended gallbladder with multiple stones

relevant_findings.physical_exam: Alert, oriented, no acute distress, trace tenderness in epigastrium, soft abdomen, no rebound tenderness or guarding

relevant_findings.neck: supple, JVP not elevated, no LAD
relevant_findings.lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, with faint crackles at the bilateral lung bases
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 + S2, no murmurs, rubs, gallops
relevant_findings.abdomen: soft, trace tenderness in epigastrium, non-distended, bowel sounds present, no organomegaly

relevant_findings.chest_radiograph: Opacities have slightly worsened in the axillary portion of the right lung and right lower lobe, concerning for pneumonia. Asymmetric pulmonary edema has improved in the left lung but worsened in the right lung.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Right lung findings worsened whereas left lung improved.
